alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 11 at 12:00AM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM BEGINS LATE TONIGHT... .Rain will transition to heavy, wet snow after midnight tonight and continue through much of the first half of Monday. Snowfall rates of between 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible during the Monday morning commute, making travel very difficult. Scattered power outages are likely due to falling limbs from the sticky nature of the snow combined with increasingly gusty winds Monday afternoon. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Northern Oxford Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Grafton and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...A winter storm will bring a period of snowfall to the area. Although snowfall amounts will be lighter, travel will still be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on untreated roads. The potential exists for snowbands that will bring periods of locally heavy snowfall, which will lead to rapid snow accumulations and dangerous travel conditions. Heavy wet snow will cause weighted tree limbs of conifers and leafed trees, leading to snapped branches. Isolated to scattered outages possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford
